p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p:
All codes in this table are from the system
http://hl7.org/fhir/task-status

tr.td: The task is ready to be acted upon and action is sought.
The potential performer has agreed to execute the task but has not yet started work.
The potential performer who claimed ownership of the task has decided not to execute it prior to performing any action.

description.value: This is the status of the prescription for the coprescriber

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p:
All codes in this table are from the system
https://www.ehealth.fgov.be/standards/fhir/CodeSystem/be-nursing-annex81-inadequate-adherence

tr.td: Expressing difficulty in cooperating with the prescribed treatment
Directly observed behavior that indicates a lack of adherence
Medicines that have not been used or have been partially used
No support from family, friends, social environment

description.value: Codes to define a type of nursing annex81 inadequate adherence.

display.value: Expressing difficulty in cooperating with the prescribed treatment
Directly observed behavior that indicates a lack of adherence
Medicines that have not been used or have been partially used
No support from family, friends, social environment

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p:
All codes in this table are from the system
https://www.ehealth.fgov.be/standards/fhir/CodeSystem/be-nursing-annex81-inadequate-adherence-link

tr.td: Dementia: the diagnosis of dementia was established by a physician
A temporary motor deficit of one or both upper limbs that makes it impossible to manipulate the packs
A definitive motor deficit of one or both upper limbs that makes it impossible to manipulate the packs
A complex medication: intake of at least 5 different molecules per day divided over at least 3 intakes per day

description.value: Codes to define a type of nursing annex81 inadequate adherence link.

display.value: Dementia: the diagnosis of dementia was established by a physician
A temporary motor deficit of one or both upper limbs that makes it impossible to manipulate the packs
A definitive motor deficit of one or both upper limbs that makes it impossible to manipulate the packs
A complex medication: intake of at least 5 different molecules per day divided over at least 3 intakes per day
